request.description: Request for user account information.

Request for all integrations available to this user account.

IDs can be used for API actions that require integrations.

Create a new user account on an agency instance

#### name - string - required
Username of the new user account to be created

#### email - string - required
email of the new user account to be created

#### teamId - integer - required
All users on an agency instance need to be assigned to a team belonging to the instance owner.   
Team IDs can be parsed from the response to an API request to:   
`GET /api/v1/user`

#### role - string - required
The Team Role for the new user on their assigned team.   
Accepts: `admin || staff || client`
Request for all servers belonging to User.

Request for all servers belonging to a user.  
Returns a summarised object for each server detailing only the most important data.  

#### summary - boolean

summary key accepts `true`||`false` values.

For each server the response will contain:
- id   
- label    
- ip   
- region    
- sub_id (from provider) 
- subdomain (for monit/phpma sites)       
- webserver (nginx or openlitespeed)      
- database (percona or mariadb)

response.name: get a summary of all servers belonging to a user

request.description: Request for individual server data

response.name: get single server by server id in request url

request.description:
Request for an individual server belonging to a user   
Returns a summarised object for the provided server id detailing only the most important data   

#### summary - boolean
summary key accepts `true`||`false` values.    

For each server the response will contain:
- id
- label
- ip
- region
- sub_id (from provider)
- subdomain (for monit/phpma sites)
- webserver (nginx or openlitespeed)
- database (percona or mariadb)

response.name: get summary of single server by ID

request.description:
Get all available Digital Ocean Plans to make a `POST` build request using `plan_id` and `region_id`  
  
Will provide the necessary `plan_id` with each plan containing a `regions` json containing the `id` of available regions for that plan.

Get all available Vultr Plans to make a `POST` build request using `plan_id` and `region_id`  
  
Will provide the necessary `plan_id` with each plan containing a `regions` json containing the `id` of available regions for that plan.

Get all available Linode Plans to make a `POST` build request using `plan_id` and `region_id`  
  
Will provide the necessary `plan_id` with each plan containing a `regions` json containing the `id` of available regions for that plan.

Get all available AWS Lightsail Plans to make a `POST` build request using `plan_id` and `region_id`

Will provide the necessary `plan_id` with each plan containing a `regions` json containing the `id` of available regions for that plan.

Get all available UpCloud Plans to make a `POST` build request using `plan_id` and `region_id`

Will provide the necessary `plan_id` with each plan containing a `regions` json containing the `id` of available regions for that plan.
Request for all servers belonging to User.

response.name: get server build progress - build preparing
get server build progress - build complete

item.name: clone all sites to another server

request.description:
Clone all sites from origin server to destination server.

#### clone_to_server - integer - required

`clone_to_server` accepts an integer value as the `id` of the destination server to clone to.

response.name: clone all sites to another server

response.name: Update Server Timezone to EST - America/Detroit locale

request.description:
Update server security updates reboot settings by using server id as url parameter

#### security_updates_reboot - boolean
`security_updates_reboot` can have the following values:   
`true||false`

#### security_updates_reboot_time - string
`security_updates_reboot_time` can have the following value:   
24 hour time, excluding seconds, colon separated hours and minues   
e.g. 02:30  
    
         
##### Note:
Either or both values can be passed, however if `security_updates_reboot` is currently set to `false`,   
then updating it's reboot time will also enable security reboots.

response.name: enable security updates and set security reboot to 4am

item.name: update server from v1 backups to v2 backups system

request.description:
Update server from backups v1 system to backups v2 system

#### update_backups_system - boolean

`update_backups_system` can have the following values:  
`true   `

#### enable_site_local_backups - boolean

If passed `true` then once the system has been updated to backups v2 it will enable local automated backups on an hourly schedule set to midnight.

`enable_site_local_backups` can have the following values:  
`true`

response.name: update server backups system to v2 and enable automatic local backups for all sites on the server

request.description:
Create a new custom server in the GridPane App

#### name - string - required

The label/hostname for your server.

#### ip - string - required

Accepte `ipv4` only.

#### datacenter - string - required

Provide the datacenter or other string you wish to associate with the server.

#### webserver - string - required

Provide the webserver you wish to build the server with.

Accepts `nginx` or `openlitespeed`

#### database - string - required

Provide the database you wish to build the server with.

Accepts `percona` or `mariadb`

response.name: create a new custom server

item.name: create a new digital ocean server

request.description:
Create a new Digital Ocean server in the GridPane App

#### integration_id - integer - required

The ID of the Digital Ocean integration attached to the account that you wish to use.  
  
Can be found using `GET` current user integrations

#### name - string - required

The label/hostname for your server.

#### region_id - string - required

The region id for your server specifies which Digital Ocean datacenter to build your server in.  
  
Can be found using `GET` Digital Ocean server plans

#### plan_id - string - required

The plan id for your server specifies the server you want to build according to available Digital Ocean server plans.  
  
Can be found using `GET` Digital Ocean server plans

#### webserver - string - required

Provide the webserver you wish to build the server with.

Accepts `nginx` or `openlitespeed`

#### database - string - required

Provide the database you wish to build the server with.

Accepts `percona` or `mariadb`

#### enable_auto_backups - boolean - optional

Do you want to enable backups at Digital Ocean for this server

Accepts `true` or `false`

response.name: create a new digital ocean server
response.body:
{
    "server_id": 1764,
    "building": {
        "integration_id": 42,
        "provider": "digitalocean",
        "name": "life-squared",
        "region_id": "nyc1",
        "plan_id": "s-2vcpu-2gb-amd",
        "webserver": "nginx",
        "database": "percona",
        "enable_auto_backups": true
    },
    "build_status": "Preparing to initiate build... waiting for ready callback from server!",
    "temp_pass": "LpdvsJCA2u8E6Rc"
}

request.description:
Create a new Vultr server in the GridPane App

#### integration_id - integer - required

The ID of the Vultr integration attached to the account that you wish to use.

Can be found using `GET` current user integrations

#### name - string - required

#### region_id - string - required

The region id for your server specifies which Digital Ocean datacenter to build your server in.

Can be found using `GET` Vultr server plans

#### plan_id - string - required

The plan id for your server specifies the server you want to build according to available Vultr server plans.

Can be found using `GET` Vultr server plans

#### webserver - string - required

Provide the webserver you wish to build the server with.

Accepts `nginx` or `openlitespeed`

#### database - string - required

Provide the database you wish to build the server with.

Accepts `percona` or `mariadb`

#### enable_auto_backups - boolean - optional

Do you want to enable backups at Vultr for this server

Accepts `true` or `false`

    },

    "temp_pass": "LpdvsJCA2u8E6Rc"
}

Provide the webserver you wish to build the server with.

Do you want to enable backups at AWS for this server

Accepts `true` or `false`

}

Accepts `percona` or `mariadb      `

request.description: Request for all sites belonging to User.
Request for individual site data

response.name: get single site by site id in requet url

request.description:
Create a new site on a GridPane server.

#### url - string-  required
The domain of the WordPress site.   
This will be created in the domains table and attached to the site as the primary domain.

#### server_id - integer - required
The id of the server on which to build the site.

#### php_version - string - required
Accepted versions: `7.2` `7.3` `7.4`

#### pm - string - required
PHP-FPM process management
Accepted values: `dynamic` `static` `ondemand`

#### nginx_caching - string - required
Nginx Page caching
Accepted values: `redis` `fastcgi` `none`

#### system_user_id - integer || username - string :: *required*
Either `username` or `system_user_id` is required.  
If you enter both a `system_user_id` and `username` that do not match, the request will error.  

`system_user_id`:  
A valid system user id from the server to set as the site owner.  

`username` can be:
1. The username of an existing system user on the server to which to assign site ownership
2. A new user to create on the server and to whom the site ownership shall be assigned.

#### waf - string - optional
The WAF to enable on the site.
Accepted values: `6G` `7G` `modsec`

#### smtp - integer - optional
The integration ID of the SMTP integration to set up on the site.

Use the `GET /user/integration` to find your available smtp integration ids.

#### dns_integration_id - integer - optional
The integration ID of the DNS integration to set use to manage the site domain DNS.

Use the `GET /user/integration` to find your available DNS integration ids.

#### dns_management - string - required IF 

Required IF `dns_integration_id` is passed

The DNS Integration to enable for the site primary domain.
Accepted values:
- `dnsme_full`
- `dnsme_challenge`
- `cloudflare_full`
- `cloudflare_challenge`

#### wp_users - json array with user objects - optional
An array of json objects each containing a wp_user to add.   
This array can contain up to 5 users to add to the site on build.     
Each user object can/should contain the following key:values:    
**username - string - required**   
The username of the user to add.  
**email - string - required**  
The email of the user to add.  
**password - string - optional**  
An optional password for the user.    
If no password is provided an autogenerated password will be used.  
**role - string - required**  
The role of the user. The following standard roles can be used:  
-`primary_administrator`   
-`administrator`   
-`editor`  
-`contributor`  
-`subscriber`  
If contained in the request, the user with the role of `primary_administrator` will be added as a WordPress administrator and will be set as the primary administrator for the purposes of GridPane functionality.  
If no `primary_administrator` is found then GridPane will continue to add the default WP Admin from the users settings as the primary administrator for the site. 
If more than 5 users are contained in the array, the system will prioritise the users based on role heirarchy first, with secondary priority going to position in the request array.

#### bundle_id - integer - optional
The id of the bundle that will be used to build the site.

response.name: create site and assign to existing user by system-user id
create site and assign to user by username (optionally create new user)
create a new site with 3 users including a primary admin
create site and assign to user by username (optionally create new user) Copy
create a new site with bundle

request.description:
Change the server system user that owns a GridPane site

#### system_user_id - integer || username - string
Either `username` or `system_user_id` must be passed.  
If you enter both a `system_user_id` and `username` that do not match, the request will error.  

`system_user_id`:
A valid system `user.id` from the server to set as the site owner

`username`:
The `username` from a valid system user on the server to set as the site owner.

response.name: update site system-user owner by username
change site system user owner by system-user id

request.description:
Change php version of site using site id as url parameter

#### php_version - string

`php_version` can have the following values: `7.2`, `7.3`, `7.4`

response.name: change site php version to PHP7.4

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool process manager - set how the php-fpm process manager handles workers.

#### pm - string

`pm` can accept the following values: `static`, `dynamic`, `ondemand`

response.name: set the PHP-FPM process manager to Static

item.name: change site php-fpm process idle timeout

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool `process_idle_timeout` - The number of seconds after which an idle process will be killed.   
Only used when `pm` is set to `ondemand`.

#### pm_process_idle_timeout - integer

`pm_process_idle_timeout` accepts integers greater than `0`

response.name: set PHP-FPM to kill any idle worker process after 10 seconds when process management is set to Ondemand

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool `max_children` - the maximum number of PHP workers the PHP-FPM process manager has access to.

#### pm_max_children - integer

`pm_max_children` accepts integers greater than `0`  
If `pm` is `dynamic` then `pm_max_children` must be greater than or equal to `pm_max_spare_servers`  
If `pm` is `dynamic` then `pm_max_children` must be greater than or equal to `pm_min_spare_servers`  
If `pm` is `dynamic` then `pm_max_children` must be greater than or equal to `pm_start_servers`

response.name: set the maximum number of PHP-FPM workers to 32

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool `max_requests` - the number of requests each child process should execute before respawning.

#### pm_max_requests - integer

`pm_max_requests` accepts integers greater than `0`

response.name: set PHP-FPM to kill a worker process after handling 500 requests

item.name: change site php-fpm max spare servers

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool `max_spare_servers` - the maximum number of php workers in `idle` state.   
Only used when `pm` set to `dynamic`.

#### pm_max_spare_servers - integer

`pm_max_spare_servers` accepts integers greater than `0`  
`pm_max_spare_servers` must be greater than or equal to `pm_min_spare_servers`  
`pm_max_spare_servers` must be greater than or equal to `pm_start_servers`  
`pm_max_spare_servers` must be less than or equal to `pm_max_children`

response.name: set PHP-FPM to maintain a maximum of 2 idle workers when Process Management is set to Dynamic

item.name: change site php-fpm min spare servers

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool `min_spare_servers` - the minimum number of php workers in `idle` state.   
Only used when `pm` set to `dynamic`.

#### pm_min_spare_servers - integer

`pm_min_spare_servers` accepts integers greater than `0`  
`pm_min_spare_servers` must be less than or equal to `pm_max_spare_servers`  
`pm_min_spare_servers` must be less than or equal to `pm_start_servers`  
`pm_min_spare_servers` must be less than or equal to `pm_max_children`

response.name: set PHP-FPM to maintain a minimum of 2 idle workers when Process Management is set to Dynamic

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool `start_servers` - the number of workers created on startup.  
Only used when `pm` set to `dynamic`.

#### pm_start_servers - integer

`pm_start_servers` accepts integers greater than `0`  
`pm_start_servers` must be less than or equal to `pm_max_spare_servers`  
`pm_start_servers` must be greater than or equal to `pm_min_spare_servers`  
`pm_start_servers` must be less than or equal to `pm_max_children`

response.name: set PHP-FPM to spawn 2 workers on startup when process management is set to Dynamic

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool `request_slowlog_timeout`.

#### php_slowlog_timeout - integer

`php_slowlog_timeout` accepts positive integers as seconds and `0`  
`0` disables request slow logging.

response.name: disable PHP-FPM slow logging
enable PHP-FPM slow logging and set the time required to trigger logging to 10 seconds

item.name: change site php-fpm slowlog trace depth

request.description:
Change php-fpm site pool `request_slowlog_trace_depth`.

#### php_slowlog_trace_depth - integer

`php_slowlog_trace_depth` accepts positive integers.

response.name: set the PHP-FPM slow log stack trace depth to 20

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `max_execution_time`

#### max_execution_time - integer

`max_execution_time` accepts integer values as seconds.  
`0` means unlimited.

response.name: set the maximum execution time for a script to 60 seconds

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `max_file_uploads`

#### max_file_uploads - integer

`max_file_uploads` accepts integer values as the maximum number of files to uploaded simultaneously.    
Accepts positive integers only.

response.name: set the maximum number of simultaneous file uploads to 20

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `max_input_time`

#### max_input_time - integer

`max_input_time` accepts integer values as number of seconds.    
Accepts positive integers, `-1` and `0`  
`0` means unlimited    
`-1` means use `max_execution_time` instead

response.name: set the maximum input time to 60 seconds

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `max_input_vars`

#### max_input_vars - integer

`max_input_vars` accepts integer values as number of allowed input variables.   
Only values greater than `0`.

response.name: set the maximum number of input variables to 10000

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `memory_limit`

#### memory_limit - integer

`memory_limit` accepts integer values as MB.

response.name: set the memory limit allowed by site scripts to 256MB

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `post_max_size`

#### post_max_size - integer

`post_max_size` accepts integer values as MB.   
Positive integers greater than `0`.

response.name: set the max size of POST data to 256MB

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `upload_max_filesize`

#### upload_max_filesize - integer

`upload_max_filesize` accepts integer values as MB.   
Positive integers greater than `0`.

response.name: restrict file upload size to 50 MB

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `session.cookie_lifetime`

#### session_cookie_lifetime - integer

`session_cookie_lifetime` accepts integer values as seconds.   
`0` value means `until the browser is closed`.

response.name: Set session cookie lifetime until the browser is closed

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `session.gc_maxlifetime`

#### session_gc_maxlifetime - integer

`session_gc_maxlifetime` accepts integer values as seconds.  
Only values greater than `0`.

response.name: set time in seconds for data garbage collection

item.name: change site php ini short open tag

request.description:
Change site php .user.ini `short_open_tag` - allow the use of `<?`

#### short_open_tag - boolean

`short_open_tag` accepts boolean values `true||false`

Note - will accept `1||0` but string values are typecast according to truthiness.

response.name: enable the use of php short open tags

item.name: change site php configuration - all settings

request.description:
Update sites complete PHP configuration using a single request.  

All `key:value` are optional  

Please see individual requests for `key:value` validation instructions

response.name: enable php-fpm slow logging and adjust slow log trace depth
change site php version, reconfigure php-fpm dynamic
change site php version and restrict php ini values

request.description:
Enable/Disable the site 6G WAF

#### six_g_waf - boolean

`six_g_waf` accepts boolean values `true||false`   

`true` - to enable the 6G WAF   
`false` - to disable the 6G WAF

response.name: enable the 6G WAF for a site

request.description:
Enable/Disable the site 7G WAF

#### seven_g_waf - boolean

`seven_g_waf` accepts boolean values `true||false`   

`true` - to enable the 7G WAF   
`false` - to disable the 7G WAF

response.name: enable the 7G WAF for a site

request.description:
Enable/Disable the site ModSec WAF

#### seven_g_waf - boolean

`mod_sec_waf` accepts boolean values `true||false`   

`true` - to enable the ModSec WAF   
`false` - to disable the ModSec WAF

response.name: enable the ModSec WAF for a site

item.name: clone site with the same domain

request.description:
Clone a site with the same domain.   
This action is only allowed when cloning the site to a different server from the origin.  

#### clone_to_server - integer - required

`clone_to_server` accepts an integer value as the `id` of the server you want to create the new domain clone on.

response.name: clone site with the same domain

item.name: clone site with a new domain

request.description:
Clone a site on the same server or to another server with a new domain.

#### clone_to_server - integer - required

`clone_to_server` accepts an integer value as the `id` of the server you want to create the new domain clone on.

#### new_domain - string - required

`new_domain` accepts a string value for the new domain. 

Do not include the `http|https` scheme.  
Do not include any `www` host.  
`staging.` and `canary.` host domains are reserved for system use and not allowed.

response.name: clone site with a new domain

request.description:
Clone over a destination site with the current site

#### clone\_over\_to\_server - integer - required

`clone_over_to_server` accepts an integer value as the `id` of the server on which the site you wish to clone over exists

#### site\_id - integer - required

The id of the site that you wish to overwrite with the current site.

#### include\_db\_rewrites - boolean - optional

If you do not wish to perform a database search and replace for the destination url with the origin url then send a `false` value.

Defaults to `true`

response.name: overwrite site 2 on server 1 with the current site, but do not perform database rewrites of urls.

request.description:
Enable/Disable server level basic authentication for a site using `htpasswd`.

#### http_auth - boolean

`http_auth` accepts the following values: `true` || `false`

response.name: Enable server level basic authentication for a site

request.description:
Enable/Disable Nginx Page Caching - either Redis SRCaching or FastCGI Caching   

#### nginx_caching - string   
`nginx_caching` accepts the following string values:    
- `redis` - to enable Nginx Redis SRCache Page Caching     
- `fastcgi` - to enable Nginx Fastcgi Page Caching  
- `none` -  to disable active Nginx Page Caching  

**note**
Any active page caching needs to be disabled prior to enabling an alternative form of page caching. It is not possible to swap from one type of Nginx page caching directly to the alternative type of Nginx page caching.

response.name: enable Nginx Redis SRCache Page Caching for a site

item.name: change site nginx caching ttl with nginx caching

request.description:
Change site nginx caching ttl with nginx caching   

#### nginx_caching - string

Enable/Disable Nginx Page Caching - either Redis SRCaching or FastCGI Caching

`nginx_caching` accepts the following string values:    
- `redis` - to enable Nginx Redis SRCache Page Caching     
- `fastcgi` - to enable Nginx Fastcgi Page Caching  
- `none` -  to disable active Nginx Page Caching  

**note**
Any active page caching needs to be disabled prior to enabling an alternative form of page caching. It is not possible to swap from one type of Nginx page caching directly to the alternative type of Nginx page caching.

#### nginx_caching_ttl - integer

This value cannot be specified with `"nginx_caching": "none"`

`nginx_caching_ttl` accepts integer values

response.name: change site nginx caching ttl with nginx caching

request.description:
Change site nginx caching ttl

#### nginx_caching_ttl - integer

`nginx_caching_ttl` accepts integer values

response.name: change site nginx caching ttl

request.description:
Change site object caching

#### object_caching - boolean

`object_caching ` accepts the following values: `true` || `false`

response.name: change site object caching

request.description:
Clear site caches

#### clear_cache - string

`clear_cache` accepts the following string values:    
- `page` - to clear page cache
- `object` - to clear object cache
- `all` -  to clear all caches

response.name: clear site caches

request.description:
Run WP-CLI commands on a site

#### wp_command - json key - string

Accepts any WP-CLI command.

This is the key for a json object. The json object accepts an array of strings.

#### wp_command_and_options - json array - string

Accepts an array of strings.

Each string will form a separate command with the object key.

Each string must include the subcommand and any options.

item.name: add wp users to a site

request.description:
An array of json objects each containing a wp_user to add.  
 
This array can contain up to 5 users to add to the site on build.     

Each user object can/should contain the following key:values:  
  
**username - string - required**   
The username of the user to add.  
**email - string - required**  
The email of the user to add.  
**password - string - optional**  
An optional password for the user.    
If no password is provided an autogenerated password will be used.  
**role - string - required**  
The role of the user. The following standard roles can be used:   
-`administrator`   
-`editor`  
-`contributor`  
-`subscriber`

response.name: add a new admin and editor user to a site

request.description: Update GridPane application database with all available backups for a site.

Request to return all available backups for a site from the GridPane application database.  
  
A complete record of available backups are stored on a users server and the GridPane application database only refreshes its record of them during usage of the application.  
  
Please run the GET to refresh the applications record of a site's available backups prior to using this endpoint to ensure you are receiving the latest record of backups.i

Fetch all possible alternative sources for remote backups for this site.

Will return a list of other servers and deleted versions of this site that may have created remote backups, along with those remote backup integrations used.

Data from this request can be used in a POST request to check available alternative backups, followed by a GET request for alternative source backups.

Return a record of all available alternative backups for a site from the GridPane application database.

A complete record of available backups are only stored on a users server when called upon and the GridPane application database only refreshes its record of them during usage of the application.

For this request to return the list of backups you first need to run a GET request for alternative sources of backups for this site. Use that data to make a POST request to check for any alternative backups followed by a GET request to update the application and receive a response containing these backups.
Get all possible remote backup integrations available to a user for their sites.
Get a site's attached remote backup integrations.
Get the backup schedules for all sites belonging to a user.

item.name: Get all sites on server backup schedules

request.description: Get the backup schedules for all sites on a server.
Get the backups schedule for a single site.
Get the prune schedules for a site backups.

item.name: Add remote backup integration to site

request.description:
Request to attach a remote backup integration to a site.

#### integration\_id - integer - required

The integration id for the remote backup provider you wish to use.

Find available integrations using a GET request for your available integrations.

Request to create a new manual backup for a site.

#### type - string - required

The type of backup you wish to create, accepts:
- `local`
- `remote`

#### integration_id - integer - required IF

Required if `type == remote`

Accepts integration ids belonging to user integrations attached to the site.

#### tag - string - optional

Accepts alphanumeric strings with dashes
- upto 32 characters
- reserved keywords disallowed
  - manual (lower/upper case)
  - auto (lower/upper case)

response.name: Create a new backup local backup and tag it.
Create a new remote backup using attached integration 2001

request.description:
Request to run a check for any remote backups for a site that may have been created on another server.  
  
#### alternative_server_id - integer - required

ID of other server from where a remote backup may have been created.

Use a GET alternative backups sources for this ID

#### integration_id - integer - required

ID of the remote integration that may have been used to create a remote backup on another server with this site.

Use a GET alternative backups sources for this ID

Request to restore a backup

#### backup_source - string - required

The source of the backup to restore, accepts:
- `local`
- `aws-s3`
- `backblaze`
- `dropbox`
- `wasabi`

#### source_type - string - required

The type of the source of the backup to restore, accepts:
- `original`
- `alternative`

`original` is used when restoring a backup that was created on this server.

`alternative` is used when restoring a remote backup that was created on another server.

#### backup_type - string - required

The type of backup:
- `manual`
- `automatic`

#### backup - string - required

The backup that you want to restore. This will be a string composed of a date, a time, and optionally a tag.

e.g
`2021-11-24 08:59`
`2021-11-24 08:59 mytag`

response.name: Restore a tagged remote backup manually created by a site
Restore a remote backup created by a site with the same primary domain on another server.

item.name: Enable/Disable automatic backups for a site

request.description:
Enable/Disable remote/local automatic backups for a site

#### type - string - required

Type of automatic backup to enable/disable:
- `local`
- `remote`

#### enable - boolean - required

Whether to enable or disable:
- `true == enable`
- `false == disable`

response.name: Enable remote backups for a site

request.description:
Update a sites backup schedule

#### id - integer - required

Integer of the site's backup schedule that you want to update.

Use a GET site backup schedule to get the schedule id.

#### bup_schedule - string - required

The type of backup schedule to set, accepts:
- `hourly`
- `daily`
- `weekly`
- `monthly`

#### minute - integer - required

The minute of the hour to run the schedule. 

#### hour - integer - required IF

required if `bup_schedule` is `daily||weekly||hourly`

The hour of the day to run the schedule. Accepts `0` to `23`

#### day - integer - required IF

required if `bup_schedule` is `weekly` or `hourly`

The hour of the day to run the schedule. 

If `bup_schedule` is weekly then accepts `0` to `6` with `0` being Sunday.

If `bup_schedule` is monthly then accepts `1` to `28`.

response.name: Update site backup schedule to run backups at half past every hour
Update site backup schedule to run backups at midnight on the 1st of the Month

request.description:
Purge a backup

#### backup\_source - string - required

The source of the backup to be purged, accepts:

*   `local`
*   `aws-s3`
*   `backblaze`
*   `dropbox`
*   `wasabi`
    

#### backup\_type - string - required

The type of backup to be purged, accepts:

*   `manual`
*   `automatic`
    

#### backup - string - required

The backup that you want to purge. This will be a string composed of a date, a time, and optionally a tag.

e.g  
`2021-11-24 08:59`  
`2021-11-24 08:59 mytag`

response.name: Purge a tagged remote manual site backup

item.name: Purge a range of site backups

request.description:
Purge a range of backups  
  
Purging a range of backups will purge any backups between that range, be they automatic or manual backups.  
  
Please be careful. If you wish to keep a backup within that range of backups you wish to remove, then perform two purges. Purge a range up to the backup you wish to keep first. Then purge a range after the backup you wish to keep up to the final backup you wish to purge.

#### backup\_source - string - required

The source of the backup to be purged, accepts:

*   `local`
*   `aws-s3`
*   `backblaze`
*   `dropbox`
*   `wasabi`
    

#### from\_backup - string - required

The backup from which you want the range of backups to purge to being i.e. the oldest backup in the range you want to purge  
  
This backup can be either from the manual or automatic backups  
  
This will be a string composed of a date, a time, and optionally a tag.

e.g  
`2021-11-24 08:59`  
`2021-11-24 08:59 mytag`

#### from\_backup - string - required

The backup up to which you want the range of backups to purge to i.e. the newest backup in the range you want to purge  
  
This backup can be either from the manual or automatic backups  
  
This will be a string composed of a date, a time, and optionally a tag.

e.g  
`2021-11-25 08:59`  
`2021-11-25 08:59 mytag`

response.name: Purge a year of backups from a site remote storage.

request.description:
Update the prune schedule for a site

#### backup\_type - string - required

The type of backup for which you wish to adjust the prune schedule, accepts:

*   `local`
*   `remote`
    

#### retain\_days - integer - required

The maximum number of days that the backups should be kept for before pruning them out, accepts

*   `0` (unlimited)
*   `30`
*   `90`
*   `180`
*   `360`
    

#### prune\_schedule - integer - required

The schedule that backups should be pruned by, accepts:

*   `0` keep daily backups
*   `1` keep daily backups for a week, then weekly backups
*   `2` keep daily backups for a month, then monthly backups
*   `3` keep daily backups for a week, then weekly backups for a month, then monthly backups

response.name: Set site local backups prune schedule to daily backups with a retention of 30 days

item.name: Remove remote backup integration from site

request.description:
Detach a remote backup integration from a site

#### integration_id - integer - required

ID of the remote backup integration you wish to remove.

Use a GET site backup integrations to get this ID and confirm removal.

response.name: Remove remote backup integration 23 from a site
